attributes.action: Fund all costs of individuals who enter the UK illegally from foreign aid budget
attributes.additional_details: The majority of the people in this country are struggling with daily living costs. More money is needed to help the people of this country and domestic funding should not be allocated to people trying to enter this country illegally. The foreign aid budget should be used to cover all processing of individuals and include all costs relating to housing, legal aid, clothing, feeding to the Rwanda scheme.
attributes.background: Currently billions each year is spent as a result of illegal attempts to enter the UK. Costs involved are huge, including the Rwanda scheme. This money must come out of the foreign aid budget. This should include housing, clothing, feeding, pick up costs and all legal costs.
